result.hateful_meaning: In Canada, an Irish Catholic [19th century on; origin uncertain: perhaps from Dugan, an Irish surname].
In Canada, an Irish Catholic [19th century on; origin uncertain: perhaps from Dugan, an Irish surname].

Used by opponents of Islamisation and Muslim immigration to denote those who in their eyes facilitate it, with connotation of 'traitor'. Used in several languages in that sense, but originally an Islamic term referring to Jewish and Christian minorities.
An Arab, Indian Sikh or other individual of Middle Eastern or South Asian descent wearing traditional headdress such as turbans or keffiyehs. Sometimes used generically for all Islamic nations.
A derogatory contraction of the words "didn't do," popularized as a slur against black people as a mockery of regional pronunciation
A black person. Used in the novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.
An Australian
[1] A person of east African descent, from Cush (modern day Ethiopia or Sudan). [2] Any black African.

An Italian, Spaniard or Portuguese person, possibly derived from the Spanish name, 'Diego,' a corruption of the title Hidalgo (member of the Gentry, from Spanish > hijo de algo 'son of someone [important]' or the Sardinian language first person pronoun, dego)t.

A black person. The term may cause offense. though Randall Kennedy's Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word notes that some judges have considered 'darky' a 'term of endearment.' In South Africa, it can be considered offensive (depending on the context), but is commonly used among black people to refer to other black people in a non-derogatory way.

An Italian, Spaniard or Portuguese person, possibly derived from the Spanish name, 'Diego,' a corruption of the title Hidalgo (member of the Gentry, from Spanish > hijo de algo 'son of someone [important]' or the Sardinian language first person pronoun, dego)t.
Dark skinned person
A person of East Indian origin.
A person of East Indian origin.
A person of East Indian origin.
[1] A person of east African descent, from Cush (modern day Ethiopia or Sudan). [2] Any black African.
A black person, particularly a black woman.
A males homosexual

[1] Comparing someone (usually Male) to female genitalia. A variant of "pussy", but generally regarded as far more offensive. [2] A despicable man (Australian English). Has a wide variety of usages and meaning across the English world. For instance, in Commonwealth Countries such as Britain, Australia or New Zealand it can be, and often is, used to refer positively to someone, while in Canada it is widely seen to be highly offensive.
Originates from pre-Civil War US. Refers to the slaves who picked cotton all day at the plantations.
A person of Indian descent, from the worship of cows.
A Native American.
A poor Appalachian or poor Southerner, a white person, first used in the 19th century.
result.nonhateful_meaning: [1] Snack [2] Hacker [3] American musical group [4] British television show

result.hateful_meaning: Some concatenation of Congo and mongoloid
Equivalent of 'golliwog' in reference to black people

[1] In North America, unskilled Asian labor, usually Chinese (originally used in 19th-century for Chinese railroad labor). Possibly from Hindi kuli, day laborer. [2] Racial epithet for Indo-Caribbean people, especially in Guyana, Trinidad and Tobago and South African Indians.
A Canadian of African descent; sometimes applied to aboriginals
A black person. Possibly from Portuguese barracco, a building constructed to hold slaves for sale (1837). Popularized by the song 'Zip Coon', played at Minstrel shows in the 1830s.
A black person.

[1] A person of Hispanic descent who's accused of acting white. [2] In, New Zealand/Australia, a Pacific Islander. Named after the coconut, the nut from the coconut palm. [3], In the UK, a black person who exhibits behaviour associated with caucasians. [4] In the USA, a black person trying to be 'white'. [5] In South Africa, a black person who acts white. [6], In Canada, an individual of South Asian (typically Dravidian) descent, who is accused of trying to be 'white'.
A black person.
A black person.

[1] Comparing someone (usually Male) to female genitalia. A variant of "pussy", but generally regarded as far more offensive. [2] A despicable man (Australian English). Has a wide variety of usages and meaning across the English world. For instance, in Commonwealth Countries such as Britain, Australia or New Zealand it can be, and often is, used to refer positively to someone, while in Canada it is widely seen to be highly offensive.
A person accused of being an homosexual
A homosexual who engages in oral sex
A black person.
A Scientologist, referring to a passage about clam engrams in L. Ron Hubbard's 1952 book, What To Audit, later renamed The History Of Man
A Dutch person
A person accused of being an homosexual
A person of Asian descent with perceived Caucasian mannerisms. Concatenation of Chinese and honky.
A Jew, an allusion to Jewish deicide. On occasion it can also be used as an anti-Italian slur on the basis the Romans, as ancestors of the present-day Italians, executed Jesus.
[1] An individual of Canadian aboriginal descent. [2] A Native American, from assumed likelihood of alcoholism.
A person of Asian descent with perceived Caucasian mannerisms. Concatenation of Chinese and honky.
A Scientologist, referring to a passage about clam engrams in L. Ron Hubbard's 1952 book, What To Audit, later renamed The History Of Man
A person who engages in relationships with hispanic individuals
A person who engages in relationships with Hispanic individuals
Pejorative term
Found offensive, although it is a translation of the Chinese. It was used in the gold rush and railway-construction eras in western North America, when discrimination against Chinese was common.
A Filipino, particularly having a Mexican and Chinese heritage.
A person of perceived Chinese or East Asian descent. An offensive term that has raised considerable controversy, for example when used by comedian Rosie O'Donnell.
A person of mixed black and Chinese parentage.
A rural person of Chinese descent.
An Anglo-Indian or Eurasian half-caste [probably from Hindi chi-chi fie!, literally, dirt] Also can refer to English spoken with a Southwest Asian accent.
An Anglo-Indian or Eurasian half-caste [probably from Hindi chi-chi fie!, literally, dirt] Also can refer to English spoken with a Southwest Asian accent.
[1] A Chinese person trying to act like a black person. [2] A person of mixed black and Asian parentage.
A person of Hispanic descent.
Acts of aggression commited by a black person
In the late 1900s, Chinese people in Australia were often referred to as 'Celestials', a reference to their coming from the 'Celestial Empire' (i.e. China)
A disreputable and/or working class person
A disreputable and/or working class person
In the UK, an unsophisticated or working class person with a predilection for ostentatious sportswear and jewellery
A Mormon, presumably inspired by agriculture in Utah
Derogatory term for someone from Catalan
A person of mixed Caucasian, African and Asian heritage
A person of Middle Eastern descent
Person of Middle Eastern descent.
An Austrialian, from the perception that Australians drink a lot of canned beer.
Ethnic slur directed at Italians
A person of Arabic descent, from Aladdin and his magic carpet.
A person of Indian or Middle Eastern descent, based on the perceived surfeit of immigrants driving cabs in the United States.
Person of Middle Eastern descent.
[1] An Arab. [2] A Muslim.
Person of Middle Eastern descent.
Person of Middle Eastern descent.

[1] Australian aboriginal. Boong, pronounced with (like the vowel in bull), is related to the Australian English slang word bung, meaning dead; infected; or dysfunctional. From bung, to go bung 'Originally to die, then to break down, go bankrupt, cease to function [Ab. bong dead]'. Highly offensive. [2] In New Zealand, a Pacific Islander.

[1] Australian aboriginal. Boong, pronounced with (like the vowel in bull), is related to the Australian English slang word bung, meaning dead; infected; or dysfunctional. From bung, to go bung 'Originally to die, then to break down, go bankrupt, cease to function [Ab. bong dead]'. Highly offensive. [2] In New Zealand, a Pacific Islander.
A black person (referencing stereotypical hair type).
A homosexual who engages in anal sex
[1] A person of African descent. [2] WWII slur for a Japanese person.
An Asian. Also used by mainland Japanese Americans to refer to Hawaiian Japanese Americans since World War II.
An person of Asian descent.
In Hawaii, denotes a Filipino, from the alleged sound of Filipino language.
A person of mixed black and Asian parentage.
[1] A person of mixed white and black ancestry; a mulatto. [2] A young, brown-skinned person 1940s-1950s.
A person of Greek descent. 'Bubble and squeak' is Cockney slang for Greek.

result.hateful_meaning: A person of Korean descent.
African-Americans slur for Caucasians in the Southeast United States , particularly Caucasians in a position of authority, possibly from Efik word 'mbakara' meaning 'master'
[1] A male Native American. [2] A male black person.
derogatory term for a person of East Asian descent
Accusative term for refugees or immigrants of darker complexion
Accusative term for refugees or immigrants of darker complexion
A person of Latino descent, particularly a Mexican migrant laborer.

White on the inside and brown on the outside, like a Bounty chocolate bar. As with wigger, this is both a subcultural and ethnic slur. The immediate target is criticized for having the cultural values of a different ethnic group, with the implication that the ethnic group in question is bad or inferior. Coconut and Oreo are used in the same way.
A person of German descent.
[1] A person of mixed Caucasian, Native American, and African ancestry in Southern Carolina [2] A person of African ancestry attempting to pass as Caucasian
derogatory term for a person of East Asian descent
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.
